alert.note: Alert for Mahaska; Poweshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 10:23AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Poweshiek and Mahaska Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1023 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Brooklyn to 7 miles north of New Sharon to Pella. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Montezuma around 1030 AM CDT. Brooklyn and New Sharon around 1035 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Oskaloosa and Eddyville. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 181 and 204. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
